escjava
Class OptionsConsistency

java.lang.Object
  escjava.OptionsConsistency

public class OptionsConsistency
extends java.lang.Object

Checks consistency of option combinations according a set of logical rules.

Author:
Mikolas Janota

Constructor Detail

OptionsConsistency

public OptionsConsistency(Option[][] excludes)
Initializes a new OptionsConsistency instance.

Parameters:
excludes - sets of options, where each set imposes mutual exclusion on its members
Method Detail

addInduces

public void addInduces(Option option,
                       Option[] inducedOptions)
Add the induces relation for a given option. Whenever option is set the options in inducedOptions will be automatically set.

See Also:
set(Option)

isConflict

public OptionsConsistency.Conflict isConflict(Option option)
Test whether a given option whould cause a conflict if set.

Returns:
a conflict description if there is a conflict, null otherwise.
See Also:
set(Option)

set

public void set(Option option)
Set a given option. Induced options are automatically set as well.

See Also:
isOn(Option), addInduces(Option, Option[])

isOn

Determines whether a given option is set.
